s.text: Everyone should be careful to use a singular pronoun with singular nouns in their writing.
Writing carefully, dangling participles must be avoided.
Analogies in writing are like feathers on a snake 21.
Everyone should be careful to use a singular pronoun with singular nouns in their writing.
Hopefully, you will use words correctly, irregardless of how others use them.
Hopefully, you will use words correctly, irregardless of how others use them.
Don't never use no double negatives.
Do not use hyperbole; not one in a million can do it effectively.
Don't use commas, that, are not necessary.
The passive voice should not be used.
Don't be redundant; don't use more words than necessary; it's highly superfluous.
Do not use a foreign word when there is an adequate English quid pro quo.
Avoid trendy locutions that sound flaky.
They kept seeing people go in and then come out differently.
Go around the barn at high noon to avoid colloquialisms.
Go around the barn at high noon to avoid colloquialisms.
Go around the barn at high noon to avoid colloquialisms.
Go around the barn at high noon to avoid colloquialisms.
Do NOt forget that the pursuit of kNOwledge is a NOble task, and you can never study eNOugh.
The wife wandered off to look at something that had caught her eye, while the boy and his father became attracted to a shiny wall that kept opening and closing..
